title: Climate Home News
description: Climate change news, analysis, commentary, video and podcasts focused on developments in global climate politics

items.title: China unveils underwhelming emissions-cutting target for 2035
items.description:
Experts say China's new 2035 goal to cut emissions by 7-10% from "peak levels" does not fully reflect its expansion of clean energy on the ground

The post China unveils underwhelming emissions-cutting target for 2035 appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: At climate summit, UN chief urges countries to go “much further, much faster” on NDCs
items.description:
With about 120 leaders speaking in New York, the pressure is on for stronger climate action plans to rein in global warming, with the world off track to meet Paris Agreement goals

The post At climate summit, UN chief urges countries to go “much further, much faster” on NDCs appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Fact-checked: Trump’s UN tirade against renewables, climate deals and environmentalists
items.description:
The US president's outspoken speech was littered with a string of misleading or false statements - many about efforts to fight climate change

The post Fact-checked: Trump’s UN tirade against renewables, climate deals and environmentalists appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Brazil pledges $1bn in first contribution to COP30 rainforest fund
items.description:
Brazil, which will launch the new investment-driven fund for forest protection at the Belém climate summit, calls on other governments to put in seed capital

The post Brazil pledges $1bn in first contribution to COP30 rainforest fund appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: How Vanuatu is facing up to rising climate risks
items.description:
Indigenous knowledge and adaptation techniques are helping island communities survive the climate crisis.

The post How Vanuatu is facing up to rising climate risks appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Explainer: Brazil’s “right answer” to forest finance turns to markets to keep rainforest standing
items.description:
The Tropical Forest Forever Facility (TFFF) is set to be launched at COP30. Climate Home breaks down how the fund would work

The post Explainer: Brazil’s “right answer” to forest finance turns to markets to keep rainforest standing appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Brazil’s call for COP trade forum gets lukewarm response
items.description:
After disputes over whether to include thorny trade issues on the agenda of global climate talks, the COP30 presidency proposes a separate arena to discuss them

The post Brazil’s call for COP trade forum gets lukewarm response appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: COP30 PR firm found to be “uniquely reliant” on fossil fuel clients
items.description:
Edelman relies on work with oil and gas firms like Shell and Chevron for a higher percentage of its income than any other PR agency, a new report found

The post COP30 PR firm found to be “uniquely reliant” on fossil fuel clients appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Vanuatu pursues new UN resolution to turn ICJ climate opinion into action
items.description:
The Pacific island nation, which led a campaign for the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to clarify states' climate duties, said the legal opinion must not be "left on paper"

The post Vanuatu pursues new UN resolution to turn ICJ climate opinion into action appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Colombia announces fossil fuel phase-out summit to be held in 2026
items.description:
While a new report warns governments are significantly expanding fossil fuels, Colombia launches a call for the Global South to lead on ending their use

The post Colombia announces fossil fuel phase-out summit to be held in 2026 appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: UN climate chief says new national climate plans will fall short on emissions cuts
items.description:
With 2035 targets expected be too weak to meet global goals to limit warming, the UN's Simon Stiell says COP30 should focus on how countries can speed up delivery of their plans

The post UN climate chief says new national climate plans will fall short on emissions cuts appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: It’s time for majority voting at UN climate summits
items.description:
The head of Greenpeace argues that the climate crisis demands urgent UN reform to facilitate an accelerated global response

The post It’s time for majority voting at UN climate summits appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: The company tracking energy transition minerals back to the mines
items.description:
Australian firm Source Certain traces minerals back to the exact point where they were extracted from the Earth - a technique that could help make cleantech supply chains more accountable

The post The company tracking energy transition minerals back to the mines appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Treaty to protect deep ocean reaches key threshold for entry into force
items.description:
The High Seas Treaty, now signed into law by 60 countries, is seen as crucial to achieving a global goal of protecting 30% of land and sea ecosystems by 2030

The post Treaty to protect deep ocean reaches key threshold for entry into force appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: As governments bet on carbon trading, Japan’s early scheme spotlights pitfalls
items.description:
Analysis by Climate Home News of Japan’s current projects under Article 6.2 - from forest protection to energy-saving lights in Uniqlo stores - raises questions over the climate benefits of some of the offsets

The post As governments bet on carbon trading, Japan’s early scheme spotlights pitfalls appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: EU ministers fail to agree climate targets, raising risk leaders will weaken them
items.description:
EU countries' leaders make decisions based on unanimity, potentially allowing laggards to block ambition on climate targets

The post EU ministers fail to agree climate targets, raising risk leaders will weaken them appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: UN raises COP30 allowance to help with Belém accommodation crisis
items.description:
But funding shortfalls risk reducing the number of government negotiators who can receive the payment unless more money is put on the table

The post UN raises COP30 allowance to help with Belém accommodation crisis appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: Can COP30 turn adaptation talks into real-world investments?
items.description:
Brazil's COP30 presidency team wants adaptation high on the agenda in Belem, to move from technical negotiations to action on the ground

The post Can COP30 turn adaptation talks into real-world investments? appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: IEA says some oil and gas projects must shut early to meet 1.5C limit
items.description:
To keep global warming to 1.5C and avoid oversupply of oil and gas, the International Energy Agency says some high-cost production will need to be closed down ahead of time

The post IEA says some oil and gas projects must shut early to meet 1.5C limit appeared first on Climate Home News.

items.title: “Public health emergency”: Report shows fossil fuel impacts on every stage of life
items.description:
The Global Climate and Health Alliance documents how fossil fuel extraction and use harms people throughout their lives, with the worst effects on marginalised groups

The post “Public health emergency”: Report shows fossil fuel impacts on every stage of life appeared first on Climate Home News.
